name: Edella JOHNSON (a/k/a Edella Robinson, a/k/a Edella Robinson Johnson), Eric Johnson, individually and on behalf of other similarly situated former and current homeowners in Pennsylvania, Petitioners v. PHELAN HALLINAN & SCHMIEG, LLP, Respondent
name_abbreviation: Johnson v. Phelan Hallinan & Schmieg, LLP

parties: Edella JOHNSON (a/k/a Edella Robinson, a/k/a Edella Robinson Johnson), Eric Johnson, individually and on behalf of other similarly situated former and current homeowners in Pennsylvania, Petitioners v. PHELAN HALLINAN & SCHMIEG, LLP, Respondent.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM.
AND NOW, this 13th day of January, 2015, the Petition for Allowance of Appeal is GRANTED. The issue, as stated by petitioners, is:
(1) Does Act 6, § 502 provide a remedy, as the explicit language of the statute establishes, against any statutorily defined “person” collecting statutorily prohibited fees on behalf of residential mortgage lenders?
The Application to File Supplement to Petition for Allowance of Appeal is DISMISSED as moot.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM.

casebody.head_matter:
108 A.3d 28
Edella JOHNSON (a/k/a Edella Robinson, a/k/a Edella Robinson Johnson), Eric Johnson, individually and on behalf of other similarly situated former and current homeowners in Pennsylvania, Petitioners v. PHELAN HALLINAN & SCHMIEG, LLP, Respondent.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Jan. 13, 2015.
